intro: Carpha perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to specific regions in Africa, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into three-lobed seed capsules. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Carpha perrieri is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
